page.title: 13LANGUAGE.
page.content: There are no ethnic minorities in the village and the language used is English.There are three residents who were German born but are now British citizens. There is still a strong feeling for dialect amongst the older citizens, but the younger generation only use it in sketches and in fun. Some words have a Scandinavian origin as in dwyle (a floor cloth)"That" is used in place of "it" as in "Thats a fine day" and double negatives are common, a practical person being described as "not an unhandy man"
